Activity: Check emails and respond to feedback on yesterday's character sketches. Note the points raised and keep them in mind for today's work. More coffee!

Focus on refining the main character design based on feedback. Add more details to the clothing and armor, and work on facial features and expression. Use reference images for accuracy and believability.

Start exploring different color variations for the main character. Create several color palettes and apply them to the character design to see how they look. Consider the character's role and personality when choosing colors.
Take a break. Check out some tutorials on character design techniques. Try to learn something new.
Begin sketching environment concepts. Start with a general idea of the game's world and its atmosphere. Consider the different locations that will be featured in the game.
Focus on creating thumbnails of different environments. Experiment with different compositions, lighting, and camera angles. Try to capture the mood and feel of each location.
Select the most promising thumbnails and begin developing them into more detailed concept paintings. Add more details to the environment, such as foliage, architecture, and props.
Save the work. Review the overall work, and thinking about what I can improve on the character color rendering.
